condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Eritrean Girls and boys in the most disadvantaged zobas have increased access to quality, inclusive basic education, including in emergencies

description.narrative: With funding from the Global Partnership for Education, UNICEF supported the Ministry of Education to expand access to basic education by constructing classrooms through community engagement for 7,080 children – 2,520 pre-primary age (1,260 female), 2,400 primary age (1,248 female) and 2,160 overaged (1,080 female) out-of-school children – through complementary elementary education programme. UNICEF also supported the Ministry to develop and disseminate the national early childhood care and education strategy, reinforcing advocacy on the pre-primary sub-sector to be part of the Basic Education Programme, entailing an increase in public finance and resulting in the development of a costed action plan. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Service Delivery - Out of school children in the reporting year who participated in early learning, primary or secondary education through UNICEF supported programmes

System Strengthening - EMIS - National EMIS provides quality and timely data - score (1-4), see guidance
Number of pre-primary age children enrolled in community based CCG/pre-primary classes attached to elementary school
System Strengthening - Gender - National education strategies address demand-side gender-related barriers to quality education - score (1-4), see guidance
System Strengthening - Multilingual Ed. - Availability of sufficient human and material resources support mother tongue/multilingual education - score (1-4), see guidance
Service Delivery - Early learning - ECD centres benefiting from UNICEF interventions
Number of school-aged children accessing quality education, including through temporary structures
Service Delivery - Number of primary schools supported by UNICEF applying alternative/flexible education models
